newsitem.title: USA: Knight-Ridder April operating revs rise.
newsitem.headline: Knight-Ridder April operating revs rise.

text.p: Knight-Ridder Inc said on Friday that its operating revenues for April increased 5.8 percent to $271.1 million but would have been flat if 1996 revenues from Knight-Ridder Financial were included.
Knight-Ridder Financial was sold in July 1996, the company said.
Total revenues in April increased 0.1 percent to $271.1 million from $270.9 million, Knight Ridder said.
Knight-Ridder's 1997 revenues exclude Grand Forks Herald, which was dislocated by flood and fire, the company said.
In the year-to-date period, Knight-Ridder's total revenues fell by 1.9 percent to $950.4 million from $968.5 million.
Knight-Ridder's newspaper division posted April revenues of $244.6 million, up 5.9 percent from April 1996's $230.9 million, the company said.
Total advertising revenues in April increased 7.9 percent, while they increased 7.2 percent on a year-to-date basis.
